question: Which one of the following represents the female pelvis with a greater transverse diameter of the outlet than the anteroposterior diameter?
Which is the most common site of implantation of the fetus in an ectopic pregnancy?

A 15-year-old girl comes to the outpatient department with complaints of cyclical lower abdominal pain. On examination, she has suprapubic swelling and a bluish bulge is seen in the vestibule. What is the most probable cause?

A 30-year-old female patient is being evaluated for infertility. Serum gonadotropins, estradiol, progesterone, and prolactin levels are measured in a test that is advised to obtain data by a blood sample on her 21st day of menstruation cycle. Which of the following will indicate if the cycle has been ovulatory or not?
Which of the following lymph nodes do testes drain into?
A 22-year-old medical student presents to the clinic with a history of weight gain, worsening and thickened facial hair, and irregular periods. What could she possibly be suffering from?
Which of the following is the rate-limiting enzyme in cholesterol synthesis?
Ovaries of a young girl who has not yet reached puberty contain which of the following structures?
As menstruation ends, estrogen levels in the blood rise rapidly. What is the source of estrogen?
Which of the following enzymes is required to convert testosterone to estradiol?
Which of the following is another name for the suspensory ligament of the ovary?
Perineal spaces are divided into superficial and deep by means of which of the following structures?
The navicular fossa is present in which of the following structures?
Choose the correct order for the path of sperm from the testes to outside the body.

answers.option: Ejaculatory duct -> ductus deferens -> epididymis -> penis
Ductus deferens -> ejaculatory duct -> epididymis -> penis
Epididymis -> ductus deferens -> ejaculatory duct -> penis
Ductus deferens -> epididymis -> ejaculatory duct -> penis
Penis -> ductus deferens -> epididymis -> ejaculatory duct

question: An infertile couple comes into the infertility clinic to seek advice because the X-ray report of the uterine tube (hysterosalpingography) reveals a blockage in part of the tube that opens into the peritoneal cavity. What is the blocked part of the tube?

A postgraduate 1st year resident of gynecology and obstetrics was discussing with undergraduate students during the morning round about normal menstrual cycle and menstrual irregularities. Which of the following represents the correct order of events during the menstrual cycle?

answers.option: FSH rise, ovulation, LH surge, luteal phase, menstruation
Follicular phase, luteal phase, FSH rise, ovulation, menstruation
Luteal phase, menstruation, FSH rise, ovulation, follicular phase
FSH rise, menstruation, LH surge, luteal Phase, ovulation
Menstruation, FSH rise, LH surge, ovulation, luteal phase

question: To decrease surface tension and open the lungs during birth, significant negative intrapleural pressure is required for the first breath. How much is this pressure?
The luteal phase of the ovarian cycle corresponds to which phase of the uterine cycle?
Testicular feminization syndrome is caused by a mutation in genes coding for which of the following?
Which of the following is the major trophic hormone for Sertoli cells and the major stimulator for aromatase activity of Sertoli cells?
At which site is the testis-determining gene (or the SRY gene) located normally?
A 4-year-old girl presents with bilateral inguinal masses, thought to be hernias, but these are found to be testes in the inguinal canals. Which of the following is most likely the karyotype?
Human chorionic gonadotropin (hCG) acts upon which of the following receptors?
Theca interna cells have an important function in ovarian follicle development. Which of the following organelles is abundant in these cells because of this function?

A histologist while observing the slide of a reproductive organ observes primordial follicles at various stages of development at the periphery. The central region contains blood vessels in loose connective tissue. The organ is most likely which of the following?

The hallmark histological feature of the prostate is the fibromuscular stroma in which there are clusters of smooth muscles mixed with elastic fibers. What is the most commonly seen type of epithelium in the prostate?
Which type of epithelial transition is seen between the vagina and cervix?

answers.option: Simple columnar to simple squamous epithelium
Simple squamous to simple columnar epithelium
Simple squamous to stratified columnar epithelium
Stratified squamous to stratified columnar epithelium
Stratified squamous to simple columnar epithelium

question: Choose the correct statement regarding the development of the vagina.

answers.option: Lower two-third is from surface ectoderm
Upper one-third from fused paramesonephric duct
Vagina upper two-third develops from urogenital sinus
Hymen develop from cells derived from mullerian duct
Vaginal fornices are of urogenital sinus origin

question: Patients with androgen insensitivity syndrome (AIS) are normal-appearing females with 46 XY chromosome patterns. Internal genitalia of such patients includes which of the following?
Regarding external genitals in the female, which of the following structures develop from genital swelling?
Seminal vesicles are glands of the male reproductive system located at the posterior surface of the bladder. Which of the following germ layers gives rise to seminal vesicles?
Estrogen is required for normal reproductive function in the male. Which of the following is the principal site of estrogen synthesis in males?

Birth control pills containing combinations of synthetic estrogen and progesterone compounds given for the first 21 days of the menstrual cycle are effective in preventing pregnancy. What is the explanation for their efficacy?

answers.option: Prevention of normal development of the endometrium
Prevention of preovulatory surge of LH
Suppressing function of the corpus luteum soon after it forms
Prevention of development of the ovarian follicles

question: After ovulation, which female hormone stimulates the increase in the thickness of the endometrium?

A 28-year-old married female visits the obstetrics outpatient department with a history of a missed period and complains of dark brown bleeding from the vagina along with severe nausea and vomiting. She also complains of the passing of grapelike cysts from the vagina. Her ultrasound finding shows the presence of many small cysts in the uterine cavity. Excessively high levels of which hormone helps in the diagnosis of this condition?

A 14-year-old girl began menstruation 1 year ago. She now has irregular menstrual cycles with oligomenorrhea and amenorrhea. On examination, she has acne and increase hair growth on her face. She has an elevated ratio of LH to FSH. Which of the following is most likely to produce these findings?
Which of the following proteins are required for the transport of estrogen in the plasma?

A 27-year-old lady undergoes uterine curettage after a spontaneous abortion. Microscopy shows intimately admixed cytotrophoblast and syncytiotrophoblast. Abundant hemorrhage and necrosis are present. No chorionic villi are seen. Radio-imaging shows nodules in both lungs as well as the brain. Which of the following statements regarding this patient's diagnosis is true?

answers.option: In males this tumor is classified as a sex-cord stromal tumor
Ovarian variant of this tumor has a very good prognosis
More than half of these tumors arise in ectopic pregnancies
Response to evacuation and chemotherapy is usually excellent
Alpha-fetoprotein levels are used to monitor this disease

question: A male child is brought to the pediatrician's clinic for abdominal pain. He also has vomiting and diarrhea. A detailed stool report shows infective diarrhea which responds well to antibiotics. However, his ultrasonography reveals an abnormal location of male genital organs. He is advised to consult a surgeon for early intervention to avoid future complications. Orchiopexy is a surgical procedure for the correction of which of the following abnormalities?
A mother of 3 children is admitted for a fourth C-section. She is counseled for a permanent method of contraception. Which of the following are permanent methods of contraception?

A 15-year-old boy is brought to the psychiatry outpatient department by his parents. He reports feeling depressed since childhood and attempted to harm himself by cutting his wrists 1 month ago. He is very distressed as he has always felt like he is a girl trapped in a male body. Recently he started having thoughts of getting surgery to get his genitals changed to that of a female, which in his opinion might help him feel happy and normal. Which of the following terms best describes this disorder?

An 18-year-old female, married for 5 months presents to you in the clinic, accompanied by her husband, with complaints of non-consummation of marriage due to fear of the sexual act and intense pain whenever the couple attempts intercourse. She previously consulted a gynecologist who prescribed multivitamins and informed her that she had no gynecological problem. You diagnose her with vaginismus as a result of fear associated with intercourse. What is the best management plan in this case?

answers.option: Address psychosocial correlates and provide informational care
Counsel the couple that there is no major problem and to keep trying
Prescribe short-acting benzodiazepine to be taken prior to intercourse
Prescribe a placebo to be taken prior to intercourse
Prescribe painkillers to be taken prior to intercourse

question: The organ that shows hyper-echoic fluid-filled areas in polycystic ovarian syndrome is lined by which of the following epithelium?
Which of the following is the lymphatic drainage of the ovaries?
In a patient with polycystic ovarian syndrome (PCOS), which phase of the menstrual cycle is affected due to the elevated ratio of LH to FSH?
Seminiferous tubules comprise which of the following epithelium?
What is the most common cause of abnormal uterine bleeding in adolescents?
The secretory phase of menstruation is important for implantation. It is induced by which of the following hormones?

A serous sample of a woman with a regular 28-day cycle shows a peak of 17-β-estradiol over the past 12 hours. However, there is no progesterone. What is most likely to occur within the next three days?
Which of the following is the lining epithelium of vas deferens?

A specimen slide from the external male genital tract is sent for examination. The specimen appears to have pseudostratified columnar epithelium and stereocilia. Which part of the male genital tract is the slide from?
